member.name: T:PrincetonInstruments.LightField.AddIns.ImageOrientation
member.summary: models the orientation of an image with respect to a standard image
member.remarks:
This represents all orientations possible without distorting an image. This means a pixel in the image always neighbors the same pixels, but the layout of the neighbors differs per orientation.
Any orientation can be represented by a combination of base orientations. Each flag represents one base orientation. When combining base orientations, apply one base orientation to the standard image. Then apply subsequent base orientations to the result of the previous to achieve the final orientation.
Note, in this representation of orientation, the axes used to describe flipping are rotated with the image. This effectively means that a vertical flip appears as a horizontal flip when the image is rotated. A simple way to handle this is to apply any base flipping orientations before the base rotation orientation.
